name: Congenital Erythropoietic Porphyria (Günther Disease)
chief_complaint: My baby's skin blisters in sunlight, and their urine is reddish-brown.

lab_results.Urine porphyrins: Elevated uroporphyrin I and coproporphyrin I

treatment: Strict sunlight avoidance (protective clothing, window filters)
Bone marrow transplant (curative in select cases)
prognosis: Chronic condition with significant morbidity; early intervention improves quality of life but does not cure the underlying enzyme deficiency.
description: An ultra-rare autosomal recessive disorder of heme biosynthesis (uroporphyrinogen III synthase deficiency) causing accumulation of non-functional porphyrins. Symptoms manifest in infancy with extreme photosensitivity leading to mutilating skin lesions, hemolysis, and potential developmental delays.
